text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with my emergency spicy tomato crab
bisque this is a great recipe to pull
out when you have people coming over you
have absolutely no time but you still
want to have sort of a fancy first
course so we're gonna use a prepared
tomato soup as the base along with just
a couple other ingredients you're gonna
have an amazingly delicious rich
decadent crab bisque with like a minimum
amount of effort so here we go step 1
all right in a saucepan over medium-low
heat I'm gonna take about a quarter cup
of chopped green onions mostly the light
white parts and the light green parts
all right a big chunk of butter about a
tablespoon and a big pinch of Old Bay
seasoning so what we're gonna do is
we're gonna sweat those onions in the
butter for maybe two minutes basically I
want to infuse the butter with that old
bay and I also want to take the raw edge
off the green onions now I don't want
them caramelized the tomato soup is a
little sweet the crab is a little sweet
so we don't want the onions to get real
sweet so I just want to cook those for
about two minutes at that point I'm
gonna add one carton that's one quart
creamy tomato soup there's nothing wrong
with using prepared foods like that
tomato soup as long as it's high-quality
organic all natural all right check the
ingredients you'll be impressed nothing
weird in there but really any quality
prepared tomato soup is gonna work I'm
gonna turn up the heat to medium and we
want to bring this up to a simmer and
then because it's a bisque I need it
spicy so yes copious amounts of cayenne
to taste but do me a favor put a lot
once it just barely starts to simmer I'm
gonna turn it back down to medium-low
I'm gonna add 8 ounces of lump crabmeat
you'll find these neat little half pound
containers in and around the seafood
section of your better chain grocery
stores you know the ones I'm talking
about so this kind of lump crabmeat is
not crazy expensive it's not cheap but
it's not gonna break the bank and it
goes a long way this is gonna make for
nice appetizer size portions and I
really don't want to cook the crab it's
already cooked so that's why we're
putting it in it
the end here so the soups already hot
and as soon as it heats through which is
only gonna take you a couple minutes you
ready to eat all right so last step here
while our soup is heating through I'm
gonna take just a splash of cream all
right a couple tablespoons of cream
another pinch of old bay and I'm just
gonna froth it up now you can add cream
right when you add the crab if you want
it totally integrated but I kind of like
to swirl it in on the top so here we go
our soup is hot
our crab is hot my taste for seasoning
probably okay maybe needs a pinch of
salt I don't know maybe a little more
cayenne possibly I'm gonna ladle that
into hot bowls don't serve soup in cold
bowls that's why the soup got cold
all right so use nice hot bowls I'm
gonna take about a tablespoon of that
frothy cream and just swirl it in it's
gonna dissolve and dissipate into the
soup pretty quickly but you'll still
have this little bit of frothy sort of
butterfat oil slick on top I also like
how it looks looks kind of like I don't
know like a crab shell or some kind of
nature thing kind of a random fractal of
butter fatty goodness you want to mix it
in ahead of time mix it in ahead I like
it swirled in at the end you do how you
want you're the boss of your bisque all
right and then we're gonna dig into this
just so amazingly delicious the crab
works with the sweetness of the tomato
soup such a natural combination the heat
from the cayenne of course you're gonna
serve with some kind of bread this is
just toasted sourdough unbelievable you
got to try this and start to finish
maybe takes you know 10 minutes or so
great
emergency meal all right when you have
some guests coming over you want to
impress and you just don't have any time
